intro: Pseudocyclosorus fugongensis, commonly known as the Fugong water fern, is a rare aquatic plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae and is characterized by its delicate, floating leaves and specialized root system adapted for water environments. The plant exhibits a unique morphology with finely divided fronds that aid in photosynthesis in shallow waters. It plays an important ecological role in maintaining water quality and providing habitat for microorganisms. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
